title: Courses
text:
Current Courses

Programming for Lawyers: From 2024 this course was redesigend to emphasize teaching aspects of programming through the task of creating data visualizations. Co-taught with Lucas Thevenard Gomes.
Legal Data Science: Course teaches data wrangling, how to think about quantitative problems within the legal field, how to answer them through the python data framework and how to create and read basic statistical models and tests. Materials availabel at Github page: https://github.com/joseluizn/cdj-fgvdireitorio

title: Courses
text:
Past Courses

Programming for Lawyers: Course format until 2023. Focused directly on Python programming languages aspects and structures. Materials available at Github: https://github.com/joseluizn/progr-adv-fgvdireitorio

title: José Luiz Nunes
text:
About Me
I am an academic researcher interested in interdisciplinary work in Human-Centered Computing, especially at the intersection of machine learning and ethics, machine behavior, and quantitative empirical legal studies.
Currently, I am a PhD Candidate in the Department of Informatics at the Pontifical Catholic University of Rio de Janeiro (PUC-Rio). I also conduct research at the Center for Technology and Society at FGV Direito Rio.
You can find my Publications and Course Materials on their respective pages.

title: José Luiz Nunes
text:
Research Interests
My research focuses on:


Ethical aspects of Machine Learning development and deployment


Machine psychology


Data-driven empirical legal studies


Moral evaluation of Large Language Models

title: José Luiz Nunes
text:
Teaching
I teach the following undergraduate courses at FGV Direito Rio undergraduate program:

Programming for Lawyers
Legal Data Science
